subject: RE: [junit] JSP Validation (Was: HTML/XHTML Validation w/JUnit)
msgSnippet: ... Sadly, that s not true...      Test   The above conforms to the strict xhtml dtd. Try it with the latest IE
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Well, if the document conforms to an HTML-based DTD, then certainly a
> browser will understand it, except possibly for JavaScript errors.

Sadly, that's not true...

<html>
<head>
<title/>
</head>
<body>
Test
</body>
</html>

The above conforms to the strict xhtml dtd. Try it with the latest IE -
you will see nothing. Only after you replace <title/> by <title></title>
it will work.

More of those subtleties are documented at
http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/#guidelines

Cheers, Ilja
